Card values ​​

Cards from two to ten (2 - 10) have the value indicated on the card. The cards J (jack), Q (queen) and K (king) have a value of 10, card A (ace) has a value of 1 (there is a change, the player cannot decide what value the card will have).

Goal of the game

The principle of the game is the same, namely that the player wants to collect cards in a value closer to the total sum of 21 cards than the dealer, but must not exceed this value. A player whose sum of cards exceeds 21. is eliminated from the game and loses. In the case of the same number of player and croupier points, the game is a draw and no one wins.

Game progress

  1. At the beginning of each game, you have to choose a bet and then the dealer starts dealing cards.
  2. At the beginning of each round, the dealer deals two cards to the player and gives him one card.
  3. After the cards are dealt, the player has the option of 2 actions:
    • get another card (Hit),
    • let dealer turn (Stand),
    • other options such as Split and Double are not possible.

The croupier and his game

In normal Blackjack, the dealer has certain rules on how to play:

  • deal another card if the sum of his cards is less than 17,
  • stay standing when the sum of his cards is 17 and higher.
For this game, however, I opted for my own algorithm, which is based on the probability and chance of another card falling.
